programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: Follow David Hayman as he unearths the people and places that make Scotland unique.

programme.title: Raw Travel
programme.desc: Laos is a small, landlocked and sparsely populated country in Southeast Asia and therein lies the charm. Surrounded by larger, more populous nations like Vietnam, Thailand & China, Laos is a haven without the swarming throngs of tourists. The relaxed, laid back but friendly nature of the Lao people is infectious and as more and more savvy travelers are finding, is helping Laos become one the loveliest hidden gems in all of Asia.

programme.title: The Colours of China
programme.desc: Five colours are an integral part of contemporary China and the ancient philosophy of Wu Xing. Each episode takes us to regions where we meet our characters, learn how Wu Xing sits in their lives and explore the landscapes they live in.

programme.title: Eat Sleep Surf
programme.desc: Rian and Dylan are back! And this time, with Season 2 of their worldwide success, 'Eat.Sleep.Surf'. On this new adventure, we join the guys as they travel to the island of Taiwan, a relatively unknown surf destination, but soon to be found, a tropical island full of potential. Follow along as they arrive into Taipei where they meet up with the Taipei Fixie Crew, a cycle culture fast growing...

programme.title: It’s How You Get There
programme.desc: Sam Nehme, Julian Taylor and Jenn Barlow experience a variety of exciting modes of transportation as they journey across the country to see which one is best on, "It's How You Get There".

programme.title: American Travelers
programme.desc: Dave and Kari visit the beautiful city of San Diego, California. They check out Old Town, Balboa Park, The San Diego Mission, and the famous Del Coronado Hotel.

programme.title: Hayman's Way

programme.desc: Rian and Dylan are back! And this time, with Season 2 of their worldwide success, 'Eat.Sleep.Surf'. programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.sub-title: Camping on the Ferry to Alaska
programme.desc: Our journey starts in the Pacific Northwest as we prepare to head up to Alaska on the Alaskan Marine Highway. Our passage on the Alaska Marine Highway left from the port in Bellingham Washington and would soon carry us nearly a 1000 miles north, to Juneau Alaska. The boat navigates an intricate path through the inside passage which is a narrow network of corridors through the islands on the Pacific Northwest coast of the North American Fjordlands.

programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.desc: Our first official stop in Alaska: Juneau! Neither of us were ready for how smitten we'd become with the capitol of Alaska. In our first few days in Juneau we explore multiple glaciers, meet and hike with a few locals, try some local food and beer, all while having the most breathtaking camp views we've ever had.

programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.sub-title: Ice Caves and Ice Climbing in Alaska
programme.desc: Still in Juneau Alaska we head out to Mendenhall Glacier or Aak'wtaaksit, to the native Tlingit people which translates to the Glacier Behind the Little Lake. We spend an entire day exploring and ice climbing with some new friends. After getting to know the glacier we head back out for one last adventure into the the ice before boarding the ferry to our next destination.

programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.sub-title: Driving the ALCAN From Haines to Fairbanks
programme.desc: After leaving Juneau we take the Alaska Marine Highway to the coastal town of Haines. There we enjoy a few days of exploring before making an attempt to cross the closed US and Canadian Border to get to the interior of Alaska.

programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.sub-title: The Great One - Denali National Park
programme.desc: After leaving Fairbanks we head south to the town of Healy in preparation for some time in Denali National Park & Preserve. We take the bus to Wonder Lake campground where we patiently wait to get a glimpse of the tallest mountain in North America.

programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.desc: We spend our last day in Denali National Park before relocating to the charming town of Talkeetna. While in Talkeetna we meet the Mayor, hike to try to get another view of Denali, and catch a glimpse of our first ever salmon run!

programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.sub-title: Incredible Hiking in Hatcher Pass Alaska
programme.desc: After leaving Talkeetna we head to the long awaited Hatcher Pass. Neither one of us was ready for the rugged beauty of this area after nearly a month of Boreal Forests. We spend our time in the area hiking to turquoise lakes and make a surprise stop to fish after seeing them rise on a passing lake!

programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.sub-title: The Fishing Bears of Katmai National Park
programme.desc: This episode was life changing for us. We visit Katmai National Park and Preserve to visit the fishing bears of Brooks Falls. A place that has captivated us since we were kids. After a short flight and a float plane we arrive at the most incredible place we've ever visited.

programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.desc: When we returned from Katmai National Park we venture onto the Kenai Peninsula for the first time in our travels in Alaska. We stop in the town of Whittier before heading to Homer, Alaska. While in Homer we meet up with some new friends for a trip across the inlet to see icebergs and incredible wildlife. We also find some ocean side camping that ends up being our favorite in all of Alaska.

programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.desc: In this episode we head to Seward, Alaska. A charming coastal town where we explore the glaciers and ice fields of Kenia Fjords National Park and take to the water to try to get out to a tide water glacier.

programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.sub-title: Dropped in the Wilderness of Alaska
programme.desc: There's a first for everything. In this installment of Lost & Found, we get dropped off by a float plane in the backcountry of the Kenai Wilderness for a few days of exploring!

programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.sub-title: Surfing the Longest Wave in Alaska
programme.desc: In this episode, MAK heads out into the water of the Turnagain arm to try to surf the rare Bore Tide wave before heading back to Whittier to take to the water!

programme.title: Lost And Found
programme.desc: The day after our glacier boat tour we find an incredible scene as the salmon are running up a near by river before heading off the Kenai Peninsula for the last time. We then head into the fascinating town of McCarthy, Alaska and Wrangell-St. Elias National Park. From there we explore Root Glacier and the Kennicott mining operation.

programme.title: It’s How You Get There
programme.desc: Sam Nehme, Julian Taylor and Jenn Barlow experience a variety of exciting modes of transportation as they journey across the country to see which one is best on, "It's How You Get There".

programme.title: American Travelers
programme.desc: Dave and Kari visit Jonesborough, the oldest town in Tennessee, during the Story Telling Festival. Then they check out Pigeon Forge and the Dollywood Dream More Resort.

programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: Follow David Hayman as he unearths the people and places that make Scotland unique.
